title: NexoWorld
excerpt: An innovative mobile game merging exploration, digital currency, and social interaction in real-world environments.
overview:
NexoWorld is a groundbreaking mobile game that blends the real and digital worlds through augmented reality (AR). Drawing inspiration from games like Pokémon Go, it offers a unique twist—players explore real-world locations to collect, trade, and manage in-app currency while participating in challenges and unlocking new content. The game integrates spatial data and microservices architecture to provide seamless real-time updates and ensure high performance on both Android and iOS platforms.

NexoWorld's fusion of digital assets with physical exploration introduces a new dimension of gaming, offering players personalized experiences, in-game quests, and trading opportunities. The project utilizes DevOps practices for cloud-native deployment, ensuring high availability and scalability.
features: Real-Time Location-Based Gameplay: Players explore real-world locations to unlock content, complete quests, and collect digital assets.
In-App Currency System: Players earn, trade, and manage currency through challenges and transactions, adding a gamified economic layer.
Microservices Architecture: Ensures scalability, modularity, and high performance, allowing different services to operate independently.
Push Notifications & Personalized Offers: Sends notifications based on player activity, encouraging continued engagement with exclusive offers and events.
Cross-Platform Compatibility: Developed using Flutter, providing smooth performance on both Android and iOS platforms.
High Availability & Messaging: Redis caching for real-time performance optimization and Kafka for reliable messaging between services.
Cloud-Native Deployment: Uses Docker and Kubernetes for efficient and scalable deployment in cloud environments.

team.name: Abdelmajid ZADDI
team.role: Software Engineering Student at FST Mohammedia - UH2C

title: Busway Ticket Chatbot
excerpt: Innovative web app for seamless busway ticket reservations, using Neo4j to manage complex data relationships.
overview:
The Busway Ticket Chatbot is a cutting-edge web application developed as part of the Object Technology/IoT Workshop. It simplifies busway ticket reservations by leveraging a Neo4j graph database to efficiently manage complex data relationships, such as bus schedules, stations, and drivers. This project enhances the user experience by incorporating an AIML-powered chatbot, enabling a conversational interface for booking tickets and obtaining travel information.

The goal was to build a system that offers users a seamless, intuitive, and engaging booking experience while maintaining sophisticated backend data management. The chatbot interacts with users conversationally, transforming the traditional booking process into an easy, interactive journey.
features: Trip Visualization: Users can explore available trips with detailed route information, including departure and arrival times.
Online Reservation System: Provides a hassle-free online ticket booking experience, available 24/7.
Dynamic Data Management with Neo4j: The system utilizes Neo4j to manage relationships between buses, drivers, and stations, ensuring accurate data and real-time updates.
User-Friendly Interface with Thymeleaf: Designed with simplicity and ease of use in mind, providing smooth navigation and interaction for users.
AIML-Powered Chatbot: The chatbot offers a conversational interface, making ticket booking more engaging and personal.

team.name: Oumaima OUASLI
team.role: Software Engineering Student at FST Mohammedia - UH2C

title: Centralization and Classification of New York City Traffic
excerpt: Web portal for analyzing and visualizing traffic centrality in NYC, developed during Object/IoT Technologies workshop.
overview:
The Centralization and Classification of New York City Traffic is a web-based portal built as part of the Object/IoT Technologies workshop. This project offers dynamic traffic analysis by leveraging modern mapping tools and clustering algorithms to visualize traffic flows in New York City. Users can explore traffic data through interactive maps, filter it by time slots, and uncover critical insights about central traffic patterns.

The system makes use of AGNES clustering to classify traffic flows efficiently, along with Leaflet.js to visualize it through interactive maps. Its responsive design ensures accessibility across devices, delivering a seamless experience for global users with multi-language support.
features: Interactive Map Visualization: Users can zoom and pan through traffic maps for a detailed view of NYC traffic patterns.
Advanced Data Filters: Filter traffic data by year, month, day, and time slots to explore trends across different timeframes.
Color-Coded Clusters: Traffic clusters are visually represented using color codes to highlight areas of congestion or smooth traffic.
Real-Time Traffic Flow Insights: Clickable map markers reveal detailed traffic information and central points.
Responsive Design with Multi-Language Support: Designed to work efficiently on both desktop and mobile devices, with multi-language features for a global audience.
